quote: Green was the silence, wet was the light, the month of June trembled like a butterfly.
author: Pablo Neruda

quote: Green was the silence, wet was the light, the month of June trembled like a butterfly.
author: Pablo Neruda

quote: This is the solstice, the still point of the sun, its cusp and midnight, the year's threshold and unlocking, where the past lets go of and becomes the future; the place of caught breath.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: Destroying rainforest for economic gain is like burning a Renaissance painting to cook a meal.
author: E.O. Wilson

quote: The flame that burns twice as bright burns half as long.
author: Laozi

quote: Salt is born of the purest parents: the sun and the sea.
author: Pythagoras

quote: Salt is born of the purest parents: the sun and the sea.
author: Pythagoras

quote: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.
author: Anne Frank
aboutAuthor: German-Dutch writer and Holocaust victim, known for 'The Diary of a Young Girl'

quote: We should indeed keep calm in the face of difference, and live our lives in a state of inclusion and wonder at the diversity of humanity.
author: George Takei

quote: I hope I shall possess firmness and virtue enough to maintain what I consider the most enviable of all titles, the character of an honest man.
author: George Washington
aboutAuthor: American political leader, military general, statesman, and Founding Father who served as the first president of the United States from 1789 to 1797

quote: We should indeed keep calm in the face of difference and live our lives in a state of inclusion and wonder at the diversity of humanity.
author: George Takei

quote: You cannot climb the ladder of success dressed in the costume of failure.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: You cannot climb the ladder of success dressed in the costume of failure.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: If the Earth gets hit by an asteroid, it's game over. It's control-alt-delete for civilization.
author: Bill Nye

quote: There are few things that you can't do as long as you are willing to apply yourself.
author: Greg LeMond
aboutAuthor: American cyclist who was the first non-European to win the Tour de France

quote: Once you're halfway home, you know that you can probably get the rest of the way there.
author: Janis Ian

quote: Now came the dog days—day after day of hot, still summer, when for hours at a time light seemed the only thing that moved; the sky—sun, clouds and breeze—awake above the drowsing downs.
author: Richard Adams
aboutAuthor: English novelist whose works include 'Watership Down'

quote: We in America do not have government by the majority. We have government by the majority who participate.
author: Thomas Jefferson
aboutAuthor: Third president of the United States, principal author of the Declaration of Independence

quote: Green is the prime color of the world, and that from which its loveliness arises.
author: Pedro Calderón de la Barca

quote: Kisses are a better fate than wisdom.
author: E.E. Cummings

quote: Today is thine to spend, but not tomorrow.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: There is a kind of flame in Crete—let us call it 'soul'—something more powerful than either life or death. There is pride, obstinacy, valor, and together with these something else inexpressible and imponderable, something which makes you rejoice that you are a human being, and at the same time tremble.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis
aboutAuthor: Greek writer and Nobel Prize nominee

quote: A hero is someone who voluntarily walks into the unknown.
author: Tom Hanks

quote: If you want to find the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency and vibration.
author: Nikola Tesla

quote: Instead of controlling the environment for the benefit of the population, perhaps it's time we controlled the population to allow the survival of the environment.
author: David Attenborough

quote: It’s not what you look at that matters, it’s what you see.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: I place no value upon literal transcriptions of Nature. My general scope is not realistic; all my tendencies are towards idealization.
author: Thomas Moran

quote: Sharks are beautiful animals, and if you're lucky enough to see lots of them, that means that you're in a healthy ocean. You should be afraid if you are in the ocean and don't see sharks.
author: Sylvia Earle

quote: I can't say what made me fall in love with Vietnam—that a woman's voice can drug you; that everything is so intense. The colors, the taste, even the rain.
author: Graham Greene

quote: There must always be a remedy for wrong and injustice if we only know how to find it.
author: Ida B. Wells
aboutAuthor: American investigative journalist, educator, and early leader in the civil rights movement

quote: Bee to the blossom, moth to the flame; Each to his passion; what's in a name?
author: Helen Hunt Jackson

quote: My soul is full of longing for the secrets of the sea, and the heart of the great ocean sends a thrilling pulse through me.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Love is the most important thing in the world, but baseball is pretty good, too.
author: Yogi Berra
aboutAuthor: American professional baseball player, manager, and coach

quote: I never really thought about how when I look at the moon, it's the same moon as Shakespeare and Marie Antoinette and George Washington and Cleopatra looked at.
author: Susan Beth Pfeffer

quote: We are like islands in the sea, separate on the surface but connected on the deep.
author: William James

quote: I've always preferred moths to butterflies. They aren't flashy or cocky; they mind their own business and just try to blend in with their surroundings and live their lives.
author: Kayla Krantz
aboutAuthor: American wuthor of dark fantasy, psychological horror, and supernatural thriller novels

quote: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers. You can do anything you decide to do. You can act to change and control your life, and the procedure, the process is its own reward.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers. You can do anything you decide to do. You can act to change and control your life, and the procedure, the process is its own reward.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers. You can do anything you decide to do. You can act to change and control your life, and the procedure, the process is its own reward.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: I wanted to create an illuminated field of stems that, like the dormant seed in a dry desert, would burst into bloom at dusk with gentle rhythms of light under a blazing blanket of stars.
author: Bruce Munro

quote: That's American English for you: more roots than a mangrove swamp.
author: Roy Blount Jr.

quote: Under the heavens everything is interrelated, even as each of us to the other.
author: Max Adler

quote: Why has not anyone seen that fossils alone gave birth to a theory about the formation of the earth, that without them, no one would have ever dreamed that there were successive epochs in the formation of the globe.
author: Georges Cuvier

quote: Glad to meet ya! Name's Tigger. T-I-double guh-er! That spells Tigger!
author: Tigger

quote: The nation that destroys its soil destroys itself. Forests are the lungs of our land, purifying the air and giving fresh strength to our people.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: If future generations are to remember us with gratitude rather than contempt, we must leave them something more than the miracles of technology. We must leave them a glimpse of the world as it was in the beginning, not just after we got through it.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote: I try to eat healthy, but being Belgian, I'm also addicted to chocolate.
author: Pattie Maes

quote: Cats are connoisseurs of comfort.
author: James Herriot

quote: This is a city of shifting light, of changing skies, of sudden vistas. A city so beautiful it breaks the heart again and again.
author: Alexander McCall Smith

quote: There must be something strangely sacred in salt. It is in our tears and in the sea.
author: Kahlil Gibran
aboutAuthor: Lebanese American writer, poet, and artist

quote: Swimming is a confusing sport, because sometimes you do it for fun, and other times you do it to not die. And when I'm swimming, sometimes I'm not sure which one it is.
author: Demetri Martin

quote: Remember, in the vast infinity of life, all is perfect, whole, and complete…and so are you.
author: Louise L. Hay

quote: It is spectacular to watch an erupting volcano; but it is even much more spectacular to watch the rise of a newly exploding revolutionary idea!
author: Mehmet Murat Ildan

quote: It is spectacular to watch an erupting volcano; but it is even much more spectacular to watch the rise of a newly exploding revolutionary idea!
author: Mehmet Murat Ildan

quote: National parks are the best idea we ever had. Absolutely American, absolutely democratic. They reflect us at our best rather than our worst.
author: Wallace Stegner
aboutAuthor: American author of fiction and historical nonfiction

quote: Keep your eyes wide open in the darkest of times. Only then you can rely on shooting stars.
author: Lincoln Hall
aboutAuthor: Australian mountain climber, adventurer, and author

quote: I have a memory like an elephant. I remember every elephant I've ever met.
author: Herb Caen

quote: Don't tell your right hand, baby, what your left hand do…
author: Beck

quote: For my part, I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson
aboutAuthor: Scottish novelist, poet, essayist, and travel writer

quote: If there is magic on this planet, it is contained in water.
author: Loren Eiseley

quote: There's something about a roller coaster that triggers strong feelings, maybe because most of us associate them with childhood.
author: Diablo Cody

quote: That which is not good for the beehive cannot be good for the bees.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: If you can't feed a hundred people, then feed just one.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: If seeds waited for perfect conditions to grow, there would be no plants in the desert.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
aboutAuthor: Zimbabwean-born and Canadian-based philosopher, entrepreneur, and author

quote: I'm living on things that excite me, be they pastry, or lobster, or love...
author: Jimmy Buffett

quote: Love. Fall in love and stay in love. Write only what you love, and love what you write. The key word is love. You have to get up in the morning and write something you love, something to live for.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: It is obvious that putting little white dots on the blue-black is not enough to paint a starry sky.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: We have tasted freedom and we will not give it up.
author: Volodymyr Zelenskyy

quote: National parks are the best idea we ever had. Absolutely American, absolutely democratic, they reflect us at our best rather than our worst.
author: Wallace Stegner
aboutAuthor: American author of fiction and historical nonfiction

quote: The sea, once it casts its spell, holds one in its net of wonder forever.
author: Jacques Cousteau
aboutAuthor: French naval officer and ocean explorer

quote: 2,500 people in Bedrock, and I had to pick this pebble-brain for a neighbor.
author: Fred Flintstone
aboutAuthor: Character in TV animated sitcom 'The Flintstones'

quote: Sorry I annoyed you with my friendship.
author: Andy Bernard

quote: Give a man a fish and feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish and feed him for a lifetime. Teach a man to cycle and he will realize fishing is stupid and boring.
author: Desmond Tutu
aboutAuthor: South African Anglican cleric who in 1984 received the Nobel Prize for Peace for his role in the opposition to apartheid in South Africa

quote: People never believe in volcanoes until the lava actually overtakes them.
author: George Santayana
aboutAuthor: Spanish American philosopher, poet, and humanist

quote: Greatness is not measured by the walls we build but by the bridges.
author: DaShanne Stokes
aboutAuthor: American author, sociologist, and public speaker.

quote: I have come to the personal conclusion that while all artists are not chess players, all chess players are artists.
author: Marcel Duchamp
aboutAuthor: French painter, sculptor, chess player, and writer

quote: Climbing to the top demands strength, whether it is to the top of Mount Everest or to the top of your career.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam
aboutAuthor: Indian aerospace scientist and politician who served as president of India from 2002 to 2007

quote: Why fit in when you were born to stand out?
author: Dr. Seuss
aboutAuthor: American author, poet, and illustrator, best known for his children's books

quote: I cook with wine, sometimes I even add it to the food.
author: W.C. Fields
aboutAuthor: American comedian, actor, juggler, and writer

quote: Nothing strengthens authority so much as silence.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Venice is like eating an entire box of chocolate liqueurs in one go.
author: Truman Capote

quote: Stop telling such outlandish tales. Stop turning minnows into whales.
author: Dr. Seuss
aboutAuthor: American author, poet, and illustrator, best known for his children's books

quote: Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Islands are reminders of arrivals and departures.
author: Gretel Ehrlich
aboutAuthor: American travel writer, poet, and essayist

quote: I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book!
author: Jane Austen
aboutAuthor: English novelist, best known for 'Pride and Prejudice'

quote: You can be sure that the American spirit will prevail over this tragedy.
author: Colin Powell
aboutAuthor: American politician, diplomat, and retired four-star general

quote: It is one of nature's ways that we often feel closer to distant generations than to the generation immediately preceding us.
author: Igor Stravinsky

quote: I won't quit skating until I am physically unable.
author: Tony Hawk

quote: Geology, in the magnitude and sublimity of the objects of which it treats, undoubtedly ranks, in the scale of the sciences, next to astronomy.
author: John Herschel

quote: The most powerful weapon you can be is an instrument of peace.
author: Carlos Santana

quote: Cuando el pueblo salta sus barreras, casi ningún esfuerzo es bastante poderoso para detenerlo. (When the people jump their barriers, almost no effort is powerful enough to stop it.)
author: Guadalupe Victoria
aboutAuthor: First president of the Mexican Republic

quote: Oh salty sea, how much of your salt is tears from Portugal?
author: Fernando Pessoa

quote: One of the basic steps in saving a threatened species is to learn more about it: its diet, its mating and reproductive processes, its range patterns, its social behavior.
author: Dian Fossey
aboutAuthor: American zoologist who became the world's leading authority on the mountain gorilla

quote: One of the basic steps in saving a threatened species is to learn more about it: its diet, its mating and reproductive processes, its range patterns, its social behavior.
author: Dian Fossey
aboutAuthor: American zoologist who became the world's leading authority on the mountain gorilla

quote: Someone struggled for your right to vote. Use it.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: You cannot go on indefinitely being just an ordinary, decent egg. We must be hatched or go bad.
author: Clive Staples Lewis
aboutAuthor: British writer, known for 'The Chronicles of Narnia'

quote: Peace begins with a smile.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: The only way to save a rhinoceros is to save the environment in which it lives, because there's a mutual dependency between it and millions of other species of both animals and plants.
author: David Attenborough

quote: The solar system should be viewed as our backyard, not as some sequence of destinations that we do one at a time.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quote: The solar system should be viewed as our backyard, not as some sequence of destinations that we do one at a time.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quote: Does travel bring wisdom? I think there is probably no better place to find out than Peru.
author: Anthony Bourdain
aboutAuthor: American chef, author, and TV presenter

quote: Rivers are the arteries of our planet; they are lifelines in the truest sense.
author: Mark Angelo, river conservationist
